title: What is the biggest single-celled organism? - Murry Gans

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary reason why unicellular organisms like elephants or blue whales are not found in nature?

options.label: A
options.text: They are too complex to evolve

options.label: B
options.text: Their surface area to volume ratio makes it difficult for them to sustain themselves

options.label: C
options.text: They are not adapted to their environment

options.label: D
options.text: They are too large to survive

multiple-choice.question: What is the main function of a cellular membrane in a cell?

options.label: B
options.text: To regulate the flow of resources and waste products

multiple-choice.question: How does the surface area to volume ratio change as a cell grows in size?

options.label: B
options.text: It increases, making it easier for the cell to sustain itself

options.label: C
options.text: It decreases, making it more difficult for the cell to sustain itself

multiple-choice.question: What are some adaptations that exceptionally large cells have developed to overcome the limitations of their size?

options.label: A
options.text: They have a highly folded membrane

options.label: B
options.text: They are thin and have a small diameter

options.label: C
options.text: They have a unique biological hack to enhance their surface area

multiple-choice.question: What is the main advantage of having multiple smaller cells instead of a single large cell?

options.label: A
options.text: It makes it easier for the cell to sustain itself

options.label: B
options.text: It allows for more efficient use of resources

options.label: C
options.text: It makes it easier to replace damaged cells

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the largest single-celled organism, Caulerpa taxifolia, in the context of cell size and organization?

options.label: A
options.text: It is an example of a cell that has evolved to be extremely large

options.label: B
options.text: It is an example of a cell that has developed unique adaptations to overcome its size limitations

options.label: C
options.text: It is an example of a cell that has successfully integrated multiple nuclei to form a multicellular-like organism

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why single-celled organisms like Caulerpa taxifolia have limits to their size?

options.label: A
options.text: They are unable to adapt to their environment

options.label: B
options.text: They are unable to sustain themselves due to their surface area to volume ratio

options.label: C
options.text: They are unable to integrate multiple nuclei to form a multicellular-like organism

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between the size of a cell and its surface area to volume ratio?

options.label: A
options.text: As the cell grows in size, its surface area to volume ratio increases

options.label: B
options.text: As the cell grows in size, its surface area to volume ratio remains the same

options.label: C
options.text: As the cell grows in size, its surface area to volume ratio decreases

options.label: D
options.text: As the cell grows in size, its surface area to volume ratio becomes negative

multiple-choice.question: What is the main advantage of having cells that are coenocytic, like Caulerpa taxifolia?

options.label: A
options.text: It allows for more efficient use of resources

options.label: B
options.text: It makes it easier to replace damaged cells

options.label: C
options.text: It allows for the integration of multiple nuclei to form a multicellular-like organism

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the relationship between cell size and surface area to volume ratio in the context of cell biology?

options.label: A
options.text: It determines the maximum size a cell can reach

options.label: B
options.text: It determines the efficiency of a cell's metabolic processes

options.label: C
options.text: It determines the ability of a cell to sustain itself

title: Don't eat the marshmallow!

options.label: C
options.text: A study on the effects of delayed gratification on success

options.label: C
options.text: They had good grades and were successful

title: Why the metric system matters - Matt Anticole
